Preguntas.desc: Binder: A hard cover with clasps or rings for holding loose papers together.
Board: A flat piece of wood or other hard material used for a purpose.
Board Eraser: A tool to erase the blackboard.
Bottle: a container for holding liquids, having a neck and mouth and made of glass or plastic.
Book: A number of sheets of paper bound together, for writing, etc.
Calculator: A small electronic device that performs mathematical calculations.
Classroom chair: A seat, for one person, usually having four legs for support and a rest for the back.
Chalk: A solid piece of chalk or chalklike substance for marking or writing on a blackboard.
Classroom: A room, as in a school, in which classes are held.
Eraser: A device, as a piece of rubber or cloth, for erasing marks of pencil, chalk, etc.
Compass: a V-shaped instrument for drawing circles, measuring distances, etc.
Highlighter Pen: A felt-tip pen with a wide nib for highlighting passages of printed material in a soft, transparent color.
Keyboard: A set of keys, usually arranged in tiers, for operating a typewriter, typesetting machine, computer terminal, or the like.
Laptop: A portable microcomputer small enough to rest on the lap.
Light: Piece of glass in which the vacuum has been made and inside which is placed a thread which when passing an electric current becomes incandescent and serves to illuminate.
Mechanical Pencil: A pencil for holding graphite that can be extended by mechanical means.
Mouse: A palm-sized device equipped with one or more buttons, used to point at and select items on a computer display screen and to control the movement of the cursor.
Notebook: A book of or for notes and other writing, a book or binder of blank pages with straight lines in it.
Paper Bin: Container to throw papers, tissues, etc .
Paperclip: A clip for holding sheets of paper together, one made of bent wire.
Pen: Instruments for writing or drawing with ink.
Pencil: A slender tube of wood, metal, etc., containing a thin piece of graphite, used for writing or drawing.
Pencil Case: Container to store pencils, pens, rulers, etc.
Pencil Sharpener:  Object to sharpen a pencil.
Ruler: To mark with lines, parallel straight lines, with the aid of a ruler.
School: A place for teaching people under age.
Scissors: A cutting instrument for paper, etc., made of two blades so fastened together at the center that their sharp edges work one against the other while cutting.
Teacher: One who teaches,  as a profession.
Uniform: Dress of distinctive style worn by the members of a given profession, organization, rank, or even school.
Windows: An opening in a building, vehicle, etc., for letting in air or light.
